title: xIP vs xSP vs xBP: How to choose the target?
content:
We have 32bit & 64bit binaries, and in ROP (Return Oriented Programming), we sometimes target RSP / ESP , sometimes RIP / EIP , (maybe) sometimes RBP / EBP (I'm new to this, haven't seen RBP used yet). In ROP Emporium's ret2win challenge, I hit (with the target address) EIP on the 32bit binary, but RSP on the 64bit since I couldn't get my payload to hit RIP .

How do we choose which of the 3 registers to target when making a ROP chain/gadget?
